results.title: Love My Way: Garden of Love
results.creator_credit: Jessica Hobbs, Fiona Seres, Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Foxtel and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 10 first aired on Foxtel on 31st January 2005.

results.title: Love My Way: Spin Cycle
results.creator_credit: Ian Watson, Brendan Cowell, Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Foxtel and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 4 first aired on Foxtel on 6th December 2004.

Series 1, Episode 4 first aired on Foxtel on 6th December 2004.

results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 3 first aired on Foxtel on 29th November, 2004.

The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel).
